cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a multiterminal source coding problem, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). It specifically focuses on the problem of optimally choosing the rate of each lossy-compressed remote estimate, which involves optimization and allocation (cs.MM). The paper also discusses two models of practical relevance, one involving a Gaussian source and the other involving a binary source, which are both topics in signal processing and machine learning (cs.SI). The problem of remote source coding involves communication between multiple nodes, which is a topic in distributed systems (cs.DS). Finally, the paper uses mathematical optimization techniques to solve the problem, which is a topic in machine learning and optimization (cs.LG).
